Classes

class  Iter

Detailed Description

The SkPath class encapsulates compound (multiple contour) geometric paths consisting of straight line segments, quadratic curves, and cubic curves.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum SkPath::BoundsType
 

Enumeration values:
kFast_BoundsType  compute the bounds of the path's control points, may be larger than with kExact_BoundsType, but may be faster to compute
kExact_BoundsType  compute the exact bounds of the path, may be smaller than with kFast_BoundsType, but may be slower to compute

enum SkPath::Direction
 

Enumeration values:
kCW_Direction  clockwise direction for adding closed contours
kCCW_Direction  counter-clockwise direction for adding closed contours

enum SkPath::FillType
 

Enumeration values:
kWinding_FillType  Specifies that "inside" is computed by a non-zero sum of signed edge crossings.
kEvenOdd_FillType  Specifies that "inside" is computed by an odd number of edge crossings.

enum SkPath::Verb
 

Enumeration values:
kMove_Verb  iter.next returns 1 point
kLine_Verb  iter.next returns 2 points
kQuad_Verb  iter.next returns 3 points
kCubic_Verb  iter.next returns 4 points
kClose_Verb  iter.next returns 1 point (the last point)
kDone_Verb  iter.next returns 0 points

const SkMatrix &  matrix

SkScalar  rx,

Add a closed round-rectangle contour to the path

void SkPath::close (   ) 
 

Close the current contour. If the current point is not equal to the first point of the contour, a line segment is automatically added.

void SkPath::computeBounds (  SkRect *  bounds,
BoundsType  btype
)  const
 

Compute the bounds of the path, and write the answer into bounds. If the path contains 0 or 1 points, the bounds is set to (0,0,0,0)

void SkPath::cubicTo (  SkScalar  x1,
SkScalar  y1,
SkScalar  x2,
SkScalar  y2,
SkScalar  x3,
SkScalar  y3
) 
 

Add a cubic curve from the current point, through (x1,y1) and (x2,y2), to the point (x3,y3), and then set theh current point to (x3,y3). If no moveTo() call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

U32 SkPath::flatten (  void *  bufferOrNil  )  const
 

Return the number of bytes (padded to a multiple of 4) needed to flatten the path into a block of memory. If bufferOrNil is not nil, the path is written into it. The format of the buffer is private, and can be used to create a new path by calling unflatten().

FillType SkPath::getFillType (   )  const [inline]
 

Return the path's fill type. This is used to define how "inside" is computed. The default value is kWinding_FillType.

void SkPath::getLastPt (  SkPoint *  lastPt  )  const
 

Return the last point on the contour. If no points have been added, (0,0) is returned.

int SkPath::getPoints (  SkPoint  points[],
int  max
)  const
 

Returns the number of points in the path. Up to max points are copied.

Parameters:
points If not nil, receives up to max points
max The maximum number of points to return
Returns:
the number of points in the path

bool SkPath::isEmpty (   )  const
 

Returns true if the path is empty (contains no lines or curves)

bool SkPath::isRect (  SkRect *  rect  )  const
 

Returns true if the path specifies a rectangle. If so, and if rect is not nil, set rect to the bounds of the path. If the path does not specify a rectangle, return false and ignore rect.

Parameters:
rect If not nil, returns the bounds of the path if it specifies a rectangle
Returns:
true if the path specifies a rectangle

void SkPath::lineTo (  SkScalar  x,
SkScalar  y
) 
 

Add a line from the current point to the point (x,y), and then set the current point to (x,y). If no moveTo() call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

void SkPath::moveTo (  SkScalar  x,
SkScalar  y
) 
 

Set the beginning of the next contour to the point (x,y).

bool SkPath::offset (  SkScalar  dx,
SkScalar  dy
) 
 

Offset the path by (dx,dy), returning true on success

void SkPath::quadTo (  SkScalar  x1,
SkScalar  y1,
SkScalar  x2,
SkScalar  y2
) 
 

Add a quadratic curve from the current point, through (x1,y1), to the point (x2,y2), and then set theh current point to (x2,y2). If no moveTo() call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

void SkPath::rCubicTo (  SkScalar  x1,
SkScalar  y1,
SkScalar  x2,
SkScalar  y2,
SkScalar  x3,
SkScalar  y3
) 
 

Same as cubicTo, but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour. If there is no previous point, then a moveTo(0,0) is inserted automatically.

void SkPath::reset (   ) 
 

Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty. This does NOT change the fill-type setting.

void SkPath::rLineTo (  SkScalar  x,
SkScalar  y
) 
 

Same as lineTo, but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour. If there is no previous point, then a moveTo(0,0) is inserted automatically.

void SkPath::rMoveTo (  SkScalar  x,
SkScalar  y
) 
 

Set the beginning of the next contour relative to the last point on the previous contour. If there is no previous contour, this is treated the same as moveTo().

void SkPath::rQuadTo (  SkScalar  x1,
SkScalar  y1,
SkScalar  x2,
SkScalar  y2
) 
 

Same as quadTo, but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour. If there is no previous point, then a moveTo(0,0) is inserted automatically.

void SkPath::setFillType (  FillType  ft  )  [inline]
 

Set the path's fill type. This is used to define how "inside" is computed. The default value is kWinding_FillType.

void SkPath::setLastPt (  SkScalar  x,
SkScalar  y
) 
 

Set the last point on the contour. If no points have been added, moveTo(x,y) is automatically called.

void SkPath::subdivide (  SkScalar  dist,
bool  bendLines,
SkPath *  dst = nil
)  const
 

Subdivide the path so that no segment is longer that dist. If bendLines is true, then turn all line segments into curves. If dst == nil, then the original path itself is modified (not const!)

bool SkPath::transform (  const SkMatrix &  map  )  [inline]
 

Transform the points in this path by matrix, and write the answer back into the path, returning true on success

bool SkPath::transform (  const SkMatrix &  ,
SkPath *  dst
)  const
 

Transform the points in this path by matrix, and write the answer into dst, returning true on success
